Package nusri.fyp.demo.controller

Class VideoController

java.lang.Object
nusri.fyp.demo.controller.VideoController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/video") public class VideoController extends Object
Controller class for handling video-related API requests, including uploading, processing, and downloading video files.
This class exposes endpoints for uploading videos, processing videos frame by frame, retrieving processing progress, and downloading the processed video.

  • Method Details

    • uploadAndSaveVideo

      @PostMapping("/uploadAndSave/{user}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> uploadAndSaveVideo(@RequestParam("video") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile videoFile, @PathVariable("user") String user) throws IOException
      Endpoint for uploading a video file and saving it on the server.
      This method receives a video file from the client, saves it to the server, and then processes the file asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      videoFile - The video file to be uploaded.
      user - The user identifier to associate the video with a specific user session.
      Returns:
      A response entity indicating whether the video was successfully uploaded and processed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while uploading or saving the video file.

    • procVideo

      @GetMapping("/proc/{user}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> procVideo(@PathVariable("user") String user, @RequestParam("preset") String presetName)
      Endpoint for processing the uploaded video based on a preset configuration.
      This method initiates the processing of the video, where each frame is sent to the model for recognition. The processing result is returned once the video has been processed.
      Parameters:
      user - The user identifier to associate the video processing with the correct user session.
      presetName - The preset name related to the model used for video processing.
      Returns:
      A response entity containing the result of the video processing, including any errors.

    • getProgress

      @GetMapping("/progress/{user}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Double> getProgress(@PathVariable("user") String user)
      Endpoint to get the progress of video processing by user.
      This method provides the processing progress of the video, returning a value between 0 and 1 representing the percentage of video frames that have been processed.
      Parameters:
      user - The user identifier to track the video processing progress.
      Returns:
      A response entity containing the processing progress as a double value between 0 and 1.

    • downloadVideo

      @GetMapping("/dl/{user}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> downloadVideo(@PathVariable("user") String user)
      Endpoint for downloading the processed video file for a specific user.
      This method retrieves the processed video file and provides it for download or streaming. If the file does not exist, it returns a 404 error.
      Parameters:
      user - The user identifier to retrieve the correct video file associated with the user.
      Returns:
      A response entity containing the video file for download or a 404 error if the file does not exist.

    • procImg

      @PostMapping("/img") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> procImg(@RequestParam("img") String img, @RequestParam("user") String user, @RequestParam("t") String timestamp)
      Endpoint for processing a single image (frame) for a specific user.
      This method receives an image (as Base64 encoded data) and processes it by passing it to the model for recognition.
      Parameters:
      img - The Base64 encoded image data to be processed.
      user - The user identifier to associate the image processing with the correct user session.
      timestamp - The timestamp or identifier for the image frame.
      Returns:
      A response entity indicating whether the image was successfully processed or if no image was uploaded.
